June 22, 1962
Mr. Lou Peneguy, Director
Coordination and Information
Alabama Educational Television Commission
2151 Highland Avenue
Birmingham 5# Alabama
Dear Lou:
Thanks for your letter of June 15.,.and believe me, I know the
frustration you must feel at darting around from meeting to meeting,
trying to get something down on paper that can be used—only to
have It never appear.
The type of coverage I was speaking of for Region III that involved
Newsletter "prior to the event" type of news was handled this last
time by Larry Frymire. He sent me all the info that was sent out
to the possible attendees - and a couple of longer "news release"
types of things besides.
The little NL write-up that appeared after their meeting was written
by me, since I attended the meeting myself.
As to the speeches, several of the speakers brought them in manuscript
form to the meeting, and I was able to get them right there at the
time. Others I got promises from that they would send them to me
later...and all but a very few did. Several announcements were made
at the luncheon meetings, etc., that w© wanted the speeches and what
we intended to do with them. We*ve had considerably more response
from people writing in for the speeches than I ever thought we*d have—
which must mean that people who can*t go to the meetings are hungry
for this type of thing. And it does seem a good way to handle it.
If your speakers seem reluctant to prepare manuscripts in advance,
perhaps you could write them a oouple of months before your meeting
next year, tell them that we did this in Region III this year and that
it seemed to go over quite well, and suggest that they bring a type¬
written manuscript with them—or even send it in advance (but I
suspect that1s much harder to get them to do—as you indicate it has
been previously). Then I»m sure we can list the titles in the NL and
offer to let people have them for a quarter each etc,, as we did this
year for Region III.
